intro: Petalostemon occidentalis, commonly known as the western petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Petalostemon occidentalis is known for its adaptability to harsh conditions and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
